item.title: Connect Fail2Ban with pfSense
item.description:
Intro

Some of my self-hosted services don’t play nicely with Cloudflare proxying. This has led me to use DNS and forgo Cloudflare’s protection. Many of the guides out there require pfBlockerNG or the use of scripts that authenticate to pfSense via SSH. This guide will help you integrate Fail2Ban with pfSense using only alias lists.

Serving the banlist

You need a web server configured to serve a txt file. There are multiple ways you can achieve this but in this case, we’ll install an Apache server on a Debian-based Docker host.
